subject: Mayor Katie Wilson
methodology: I voted for her. I am feeling let down. This includes only measurable commitments with numeric targets, defined actions, or event-based deadlines.

promises.promise: Open 4,000 new emergency housing and shelter units within four years.
promises.metric: Number of new emergency housing/shelter units opened

promises.promise: Add 1,000 new shelter or housing units during calendar year 2026.
promises.metric: Number of new shelter/housing units added in 2026

promises.promise: Create 500 new shelter units (tiny homes, RV spaces, apartments) before the first 2026 FIFA World Cup match at Lumen Field.
promises.metric: Number of new shelter units created

promises.promise: Implement a dedicated bus lane and transit improvements on Denny Way.
promises.metric: Completion of Denny Way bus lane project

promises.promise: Pursue a $1 billion affordable housing bond.
promises.metric: Affordable housing bond introduced and passed

promises.promise: Renew the Seattle Transportation Benefit District in 2026 to expand bus service.
promises.metric: STBD renewal placed on ballot and approved

promises.promise: Increase Fresh Bucks monthly benefit and eliminate the waitlist.
promises.metric: Fresh Bucks benefit increase implemented and waitlist cleared

promises.promise: Remove existing police surveillance cameras and halt further expansion of city surveillance systems.
promises.metric: Number of surveillance cameras removed and no new cameras installed

promises.promise: Implement universal free summer camp for all Kâ€“8 students in Seattle.
promises.metric: Universal free K-8 summer camp program operational
